DOC.brief_summary: Poor functional outcomes has been reported inevitably, and up to 90% of the patients have experienced bowel habit changes after sphincter-saving surgery for rectal cancer. But, currently there has been no specific treatment for ARS and symptom based empirical management is tried Recently, 5-HT3 receptor antagonists can be used for treatment of IBS-D, and has been revealed to be slowing the bowel movement and improving stool consistency and urgency. We performed the clinical trial with using ramosetron (IrribowÂ®) for the treatment of ARS
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Trial Assessing 5-HT3 Receptor Antagonist (Ramosetron) for the Treatment of Anterior Resection Syndrome
